Reviews.Title: “3 Times and all Charmed!”
Reviews.Author: PrimoGypsyWoman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, wonderful hotel. perfect location, great food. Can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Shamichael
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with mostly a positive experience. Positives: - Very helpful and friendly service - Fairly clean rooms - Efficient housekeeping - Decent buffet breakfast in the restaurant Negatives: - Quite far from the train station, approx 20mins+ walk. More worse if your lugging around luggage. - Shower curtain did not keep the water in the shower. - Older style hotel and furnishing. - Average ventilation. Overall, the pleasant service outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “great deal for family of four”
Reviews.Author: asie
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the hotel malibran for 2 nights. we are a family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers. we had a fairly large room on the 3rd floor with essentially 4 single beds, 2 of which were pushed together. our room had a small hallway at the entrance which made it seem more spacious. the bathroom was small- only room for 1 person at a time, with a spectacular towel heater. the room itself was quite pleasant with beautiful views of the neighboring church. there was a tiny t.v. with italian only channels, a safe, and old- fashioned radiator heaters. the hallways were a bit dingy and didn't seem to get vacuumed daily. the breakfast was quite good, and we made sandwiches from it that we ate for lunch! the restaurant in the hotel is quite good and relatively cheap for venice. the location is fairly good- about a 5 minute walk from the rialto bridge and a 10 minute walk from piazza san marco and ca d'oro. the staff were quite professional and pleasant. overall, this was a fantastically economical place to stay in venice for our family of four without compromising location or quality!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Megsie123
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel is in a great location, an easy walk to the Rialto bridge. The rooms were clean but small. Hardly any room for the suitcases, but I imagine that a lot of rooms in Venice are small. Also the decor was a bit old and the bathroom was tiny. Breakfast was nice - a cold buffet in the restaurant downstairs. It had plenty to choose from. The restaurant was nice too. Service at reception was good and were friendly and helpful. They also helped us book a trip to Murano island that cost us nothing but the water bus back. That was a great deal. So even though it was small and a bit oldish, I would definitely stay here again. The location was excellent and the price in comparison to other hotels on the island was really good. And it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: SimoneBee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, just off the central shopping street, great locations for dinner, and the restaurant downstairs was nice. The room was decent, though there was four of us jammed into one room. However, it wasn't horribly uncomfortable. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and effective”
Reviews.Author: capewellavc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent for us. We wanted somewhere reasonably priced, central to Venice and clean. We got that and some breakfast as well! So clean, the maid must have been trained in a hospital! Much cleaner than my own home and I like clean! Breakfast was simple European. Filled me up! Bed was small but comfortable. Bathroom small but useful and clean. TV - small but useful and worked (do you see a pattern). Room. Simple, small, clean and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: nargeo
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed here in December. The hotel suited our purposes very well. It was clean and tidy and the staff were more than helpful. The location is great as you are only 5-7 minutes from San Marco and 2 minutes from Rialto so you have the best of both. The restaurant was great. The room was a good size for European standards and had very clean bathrooms. Baggage is always a problem to move around in Europe, travellers need to remember these buildings were built before the invention of lifts. Would stay again as I think the when in Venice you need to be out of your hotel room and experience the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh...”
Reviews.Author: Janetix86
Reviews.Content: Great location and good breakfast...really bad room to stay in if you have luggage like 3 girls do. They stuck us in the top floor room of the second tower and of course with no lift! The guy at the desk didn't really want to help too much either. Nothing special about the room at all. Location was pretty great though, very close to Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PerthPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, small rooms but clean. Internet available for a fee. Reception staff rude and not very helpful. Asked for refill for mozzie light twice but never got one. Location was good and could walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “We came back and it was just as good if not better”
Reviews.Author: daithelife
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last year and reviewed it then. It was good enough that we booked again and were just as pleased, despite the small number of awful reviews. I cannot understand some of the negative comments except to note that this is an Italian three star hotel - which means it has a twenty four hour reception, NOT an indication of the level of luxury! It is basic, scrupulously clean and the service given to us was never less than excellent. Rooms are small and if possible ensure you are in the main building not the annexe, as they seem more cluttered and there is no lift. Bathrooms are Venetian, small and rather strange to English and North American visitors, but are clen and serviceable, but not luxurious in any way. The plus side is the location. Less than 2 minutes from Rialto and both St Marks square and the Fondemente Nuovo less than a quarter of an hours gentle stroll away. This is as near to the centre of Venice as you can get and yet it is quiet and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Venice”
Reviews.Author: lassie79
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, we would not stay anywhere else in Venice. This hotel is well run, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, newly renovated since our last visit in 2005. We found it very central and just 2 min walk to the Rialto Bridge and getting around on the vaporatti ferrys great. This hotel has one of the best resteraunts around for evening dinning and very reasonalbe prices with great food. You need to book a table its so popular. The rooms had excellent air conditioning and a fridge, windows with shutters block out all light so you can sleep late. Breakfast was a good selection of items and included in the price. Staff were always happy to help at the front desk and confirmed our flights for us no problem and always friendly. Located in a small square directly accros from the theatre very quiet away from the pedestrain traffic. Well done to the staff and management, its always a pleasure to stay here when we come to Venice....

Reviews.Title: “Great location buts thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: Jonbagg
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, friendly and helpful reception staff but terrible breakfast, mouldy shower and generally a tatty unloved hotel Look else where...we were very disappointed for the money we paid

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic in good location”
Reviews.Author: JaynieItaly
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Malibran is reasonably basic, clean and offers a good self service style breakfast. Very good location not far from the Rialto bridge. Easily reached by boat 5 minutes walk from jetty to hotel, avoiding crowds(especially when transporting cases etc).

Reviews.Title: “Really bizarre room”
Reviews.Author: Stephen028
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, this hotel is in an excellent location, close to the Rialto but off the busy main drag, so that it is incredibly quiet, and the staff are friendly and helpful. However, we stayed in rooms in the annexe across the courtyard - small, overfurnished and cramped with a sofabed and a really strange fold-away toilet in the minuscule bathroom. I do not know if the rooms in the main building are similar or better, but, on the basis of what we saw, do not plan your romantic getaway around this hotel or imagine that you will be staying in luxury. However, if you don't intend to spend much time in your room, it is perfectly serviceable as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary -- no way a three star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaotica
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this dingy place. The room was little more than a grubby cell with a bed. The 'bathroom' was a joke -- tepid water and no water pressure to speak of, and the water went everywhere when you tried to take a shower. A mess. The 'restaurant' attached that served breakfast was also very poor and the food bland and limited in variety. We walked out after sampling the cereal and didn't bother with coffee from the machine. This place is worth no more than one star at most. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Menkis
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel at all. Located just a few minutes from The Rialto bridge it is in the middle of everything. Our room seemed to be newly refurbished and was overlooking the small piazza in front of the Malibran theater. As always the rooms in Venice is quite small, but that is not where you spend the time anyway so we didn't bother. The beds where spacious and comfy. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra01
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It was extremly clean, and had such a fantastic location (right behind the house Marco Polo lived in and about a 2 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge). The staff at the hotel and the resturant were very friendly and were willing to help us with any queries we had. It was also great that the hotel had many connections with other resturants, etc, that gave us discounts. Because of this we had an incredible dinner on the banks of the Grand Canal over looking the Rialto bridge. Throughly enjoyed the whole experience, the only downfall was trying to take heavy suitcases down quite a few flights of stairs because our section of the hotel did not have an elevator. Overall brillant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A true Italian experience in prime location”
Reviews.Author: rachandant
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Malibran was a fantastic hotel for our Venice experience. Conveniently located 5 mins from Rialto bridge and in the heart of great and reasonably priced restaurants. The staff were so helpful,m letting us leave our luggage free of charge until we were ready to get picked up and letting us use their printer in a small crisis. They made us feel welcome and allowed us to enjoy our holiday without feeling pressured for room cleaning and check out times. We enjoyed the size and layout of the hotel which allowed us to unpack a little after backpacking for a month!! great to have decent toiletries supplied also. We loved that when relaxing in our room we could open the windows and shutters to hear the streets sounds of Venice or close them up and get some real quiet time.

Reviews.Title: “Venice out your window”
Reviews.Author: MontanaGirl83
Reviews.Content: Malibran Hotel gives you privacy, and feels out of the hustle and bustle; yet you are five minutes from the Rialto Bridge on foot, and about 15 minutes from the San Marco Square. Their breakfasts were excellent, european fare; as were the dinners. Hotel was very clean, but the rooms were small. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room, it was big enough for suitcases and wardrobe, but not much else. Be prepared to climb stairs, but the hotel provides porters. There was one computer in the lobby with 30 minutes for $5. The hotel is near the original home of Marco Polo, and once you are near the Rialto Bridge you can catch the vaporetto for anywhere in the city. These water buses are well marked; and we paid very little for full access to the entire city. Study the maps before you go. The managers were friendly but you had to get their attention; their English was mediocre. We loved it and will stay there again. Brava.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariapetrone
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was in a bedroom not a hotel. The staff was not that helpful but the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good situation, pleasant hotel with air con and fridge”
Reviews.Author: AnnJonesCT
Reviews.Content: I too read the reviews and it all depends on your expectations, finances and the personnel involved. I thought the Malibran was more than adequate. Situauted only few minutes walk from the Rialto bridge and waterstop. Lots of cafes, bars and eating places nearby.( Try the Dolphin for spaghetti and clams 11 euros). The room we had was in the newer block across from the breakfast area, double bed, 3 windows with shutters, bathroom, fridge and air con ( 37 degrees outside) and a free 3 course dinner for 2 as well ( special offer in July). Breakfast was typical continental buffet style with red orange juice!! As it was very hot we took a waterbus to the Lido and swam in the sea which was warm and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: placestopaint
Reviews.Content: The photos of rooms online are very misleading. The rooms are tiny, dingy and shabby. Our toilet was so close to the wall, we had to sit on it sideways. Taking a shower meant spraying the entire bathroom and part of the room as well. One member in our group actually had the toilet under the shower! One room smelled so badly it was disgusting. The one concierge who was friendly and helpful left for vacation and the two remaining were unfriendly and very unwilling to help. The food in the restaurant was slightly above average. Some of the wait staff were friendly and attentive, some were not.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - don't stay here, try another.”
Reviews.Author: BristolMoog
Reviews.Content: How this hotel was awarded 3 stars is beyond me. The Reception area looked nice on arrival - but that was as far as it went. The lift fits 2 slim people in it only, and you need to be friends due to the size. Our bedroom was terribly dated. 2 single beds were pushed together and rolled apart at one point. The furniture was cheap, tatty and belonged in a bric a brac shop. TV channels were limited. There was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. There was a small fridge which was useful. Shower room only and a radiator which looked like it was from a School in the 70's. We paid 100 Euros per night including breakfast which was far too expensive. Breakfast was basic and self service. The orange juice was a strange looking red liquid. Staff were helpful when you could get their attention. The most bizarre thing was the fish tank next to the breakfast table with an eel in it. Not a very apetising sight first thing in the morning. The location however was good but there are plenty of alternatives, no doubt for better value. I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “lied about proximity to train station”
Reviews.Author: movinonOhio
Reviews.Content: The staff was not friendly or helpful. Everything was old and out of date. It was probably clean, but had the musty smell. That combined with the fact the paint was very old made it seem dirty. I booked with hotelsclick.com and it was advertised as being 500meters from the train station. It was way farther than that.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, very small rooms, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: PRB_Manly
Reviews.Content: Wife, i and 3 teenagers had 3 nights here. Rooms were small but that is probably typical of Venice for this standard hotel. Bathroom in one room was miniscule. Location good - solid half hour walk to the train station dragging luggage but better than the E100 water taxi ripoff. Found the restaurant very good and ate there every nite - partly because it rained and flooded the whole time we were there but also because the food was good, good value with the 12% discount for guests and freindly staff. Breakfast good value as well. 2nd hand bookshop across the road was handy when rained in for a while

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster, musty Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kmac81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated as a 3 star, but I've stayed in nicer 2 stars in Italy. My husband and I went cheap (meaning under 200 Euros/night) for our Venice stop, and it certainly showed at the Malibran. The hotel felt dirty, it smelled old and musty, and the bathroom was dark and like one you'd find in a hostel. They did have a decent breakfast in the next door restaurant and the location was convenient. That's about all the good I can say about it. Good for travelers on a budget, but not for honeymooners or a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “excellent price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: mirabel16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the malibran for our honeymoon in late july 2008 for 3 nights. OUr travel agent had signed us in as honeymooners. I dont know if that helped but our room was quite big compared to what I had seen or heard of in Venice! Cute view on some neighbor's flowers and a small street. Everything was clean, shower was adequate. Ath that price I wasn't expecting high quality antiques in my room but I did have a safe and a fridge that I could load up myself. A/C was fontionning just right. The reception was wonderful after being on a red eye flight! Attention french speaking customers, I was greeted in my natvie tongue when the gentlemen notcied we were from Quebec and said hello in frech everytime we passed by which was a nice touch. Breakfast was what we were expecting from a included breakfast in italy (cornettos, cold cuts, cheese, yogourt, cereal, toast, fruit) everthing was fresh. we had dinner our first night at the hotel. Staff was very friendly and the food very tasty and at a good price (plus a 10% discount when you are staying at the hotel). The hotel is a few blocks from the Rialto and its vaporetto stop (great with luggage!) There is a small elevator to bring luggage up with one person inside which was just fine. It is about a 15 minute walk from St-Mark's and across the bridge from the wonderful fish and produce market open in the morning (quite a show). Venice being known for getting lost easily, it was nice to just follow the Rialto directions from wherever we were and find our hotel! I would not hesitate to refer anyone here and would (will!) go back myself!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic position but quiet”
Reviews.Author: lendeitch
Reviews.Content: Remembering this is a 3 star hotel we had a nice room big but not 5 star standard the room was not that clean as we found sand on the floor from before we arrived and the bathroom tiles needed a scrub and they only gave us soap on the 1st day and we had to ask after that .The towels and bed linen were clean and fresh and the beds were very comfy But I would recommend this hotel the position was 2 minutes from the Rialto but quiet and picuresque square we ate breaksat outside and the breakfast was very good by Italian standards it was all cold exept for the boiled eggs but there was a nice selection of cold meats ,cheeses ,cereal etc The busy restaurant was very nice and good value our little daughter wouldnt eat anywhere else (you can buy a glass of wine although we were told the 1st night by our waiter we coulnt) If you are looking for a cute hotel ( 3*not 5*dead center of venice in the middle of every thing but quiet at the same time this is the place

Reviews.Title: “Dingy”
Reviews.Author: sisson
Reviews.Content: Horrible, horrible, horrible hotel. We stayed here for our honeymoon thinking we could get away with a cheaper room in Venice without sacrificing too much. What a mistake. The hotel is in a nice area, but all hotels in Venice are in nice areas. The rooms were quite dingy, dirty and havent been updated since the hotel was built at the beginning of the century. The air conditioning does not work no matter how hard you try. I felt dirty in the entire room even after I took a shower while standing over the toilet. I felt the need to search the room for bed bugs because you could feel that some type of bug or rodent lived in the walls. Believe me, there are better options in Venice even when traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bmcll
Reviews.Content: Cute hotel in a good area. Staff was very friendly and rooms were fine, nothing special, but clean and cute. We ate dinner at the hotel, very nice inside and outside seating, food was very good and as hotel guests, we got a 10% discount.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel malibran - close to Rialto Bridge”
Reviews.Author: sonia9853
Reviews.Content: very charming hotel close to Rialto Bridge and most important sites, refined restaurant very efficient and courteus staff. No dout i shall retourn to this hotel next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Average but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: lovelylassEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 102 during March 2008. The hotel website quoted us Â£425 for a 3night stay for 2 people in a double room including breakfast. We booked through hotelopia.com 2months before our trip for Â£255 so we made a considerable saving. The hotel room was acceptable and ok because it was spacious,clean and in a good location. I would have been very unhappy if I had paid the hotel website price for the stay so I would say that it is over priced if you are paying over Â£90 per night. I must admit that I was a little disappointed on first impression as it was not, in my opinion, decorated in a traditional antique way- rather an old, dated decor that made it seem shabby and in need of modernising. For a 3* hotel in Venice its acceptable but the hotel room could do with a newer bathroom suite and furniture to bring it up to date. It was tired looking rather then charming which contradicts other reviews but we all have different standards of decor etc.. The bathroom was clean, towels were changed every day even if they were hanging up to be used again and the soap & shower gel was restocked daily too. The bed was a large queensize that was firm and comfortable-the best I have ever slept in! The bed linen was nice quality and clean. The room didnt seem to keep noise at bay, this was not a problem for us as we were up and out by 8am but if you are the type to want a lie in or have a daytime nap then room 102 wouldnt be ideal-the windows are directly above the hotel entrance doors and the bedroom door is next to the store cupboard which the maids use from 8am. The hotel receptionists were neither friendly or unfriendly,they literally just checked us in and out and that was all. The restaurant breakfast staff were good-breakfast consisted of hot drinks(from a machine),fruit juices(from a machine),yoghurts,toasts,jams,pastries,cold meats and cheeses,fruits. Boiled eggs are the only hot food available. The restaurant lunch and dinner staff are excellent-very friendly,efficient and nothing is too much trouble. Starters cost between 6-12 Euros,Mains 8-18 Euros,Desserts 5-10 Euros. Wine prices vary between a modest 16 Euros up to 70 Euros. The red cabernet franc was excellent and good value at 18 Euros a bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Ditte_from_Denmark
Reviews.Content: The Malibran hotel is extremely central located, but at the same time very quiet - no noise from the streets, as it is situated in a little hidden square. The only sound came from a church that started ringing its bells at around 7am - a bit early perhaps... Our room was clean and had sufficient space for two.. The bathroom, however was tiny, but for us that was not a problem - we didn't go to Venice to stay in the bathroom... The price included a buffet breakfast, which was fine - bread, cheese, ham, cereals, jam, tea, coffee, juice fruit etc. We only had breakfast there, but the restaurant was always full, so perhaps it was good?. Staff was friendly, although a bit indifferent... In sum, it it a good hotel with good value for money with a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Cute.”
Reviews.Author: LoooveToTravel
Reviews.Content: So I'm a little late in writing my review since we stayed at Hotel Malibran in early May 2007. Our travel agent found this for us since we really didn't have a clue where to stay. We paid about 250 CAD for the room for one night :( but Venice is alllll around expensive. From the Santa Lucia (train station) we bought a vaporetti pass (24 hrs was approx. 12 euro). Number 82 takes you to the Rialto Bridge. Once at the Rialto you need to go through some side streets and plazas (past San Bartolomeo) but we had a map so it was relatively easy to find. BUT difficult if you have heavy luggage that you're pulling because the streets are quite bumpy, crowded, and you need to go over a few little bridges to get there. Overall, I thought the hotel was satisfactory. I mean the location was awesome (5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge, close to lots of stores and restaurants and bridges)! The hotel has a very small elevator (think one person with two pieces of luggage) but it was no big deal. The room was very charming. Bathroom was TINY. There was a slight problem with the air conditioning. Breakfast was mostly sweet foods. Upon arrival, the hotel arranged a tour of a glass factory in Murano for us. The glass was amazing! MY TIPS FOR YOU: 1) Don't forget bug repellant and/or allergy pills! There is lots of pollen and bugs in Venice!!!!! 2) In my opinion, you don't really need a lot of time in Venice....but have fun, walk the streets, have some gelato and a nutella crepe (or 2 lol), go to St. Mark's Square, go to Murano...

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Laulaa
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Malibran in July 2007 as part of a 50th birthday trip across western Europe. First off, the hotel was in a perfect location for us, fairly quiet, near great shopping and lots of restaurants, and only about 10 minutes from the Rialto and the vaporetti stop there. We stayed in the newer annex on the third floor. There was no elevator, but the front desk agent carried our (extremely heavy) suitcases up for us without us even having to ask. The room itself was very modern-looking, clean, and very basic, but with a large bathroom with a big skylight, and had GREAT airconditioning, which is a must in Venice in July. Sound carries pretty easily in the building, but we found the other guests to be pretty quiet, especially in the evening. We tried out the restaurant attached to the Malibran, and my mother developed a huge crush on a very charming waiter, who was very helpful with his recommendations as well as very attentive with service- and prices were surprisingly reasonable for Venice- we had three courses each, plus a bottle of wine, for under 40 Euro. Food was unexceptional, as is usual in Venice, but definitely edible and the baked pasta was very good, incredibly fattening and tasty. They've also got a nice little courtyard for dining al fresco. We also had breakfast included, which was good and varied. There is also a WONDERFUL English bookstore right beside the hotel- the owner is very friendly and helpful, and they've got a good selection of new and used books (and do trades, too.) We also felt very safe walking in the area at night- something I always want to mention, as we were two women travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: CaptainBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: Our room was in an annexe to the main hotel, on the third floor with no lift. The room was very small with what appeared to be a folding bed and little wardrobe space or shelves. The bathroom was tiny with room for only one person at a time, the toilet pulled out from the wash basin but the shower was fine. The room did have air conditioning (vital in August) as well as a full sized fridge (very useful) a full sized sink/drainer and a small electric hob. There did not appear to be an escape route in the event of fire and no smoke alarm. Breakfast was fine and the food in the hotel restaurant good. The situation of the hotel is superb, very close to the Rialto Bridge and a short walk to St Marco's Square. As we spent little time in our room it's shortcomings were not a major problem. We felt that we had value for money but I suspect a room in the main hotel would be better. Mike B

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs an update.”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Bunker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped at the Malibran late May early June 2007 for three nights. It is well situated approx 100 metres from the Rialto Bridge down a quite lane and about 15 minutes from St Marks Square. Our room was very clean, tidy and quiet but was in need of a coat of paint and a new TV and refrigerator both seemed to have been there since Marco Polo's time (the hotel is about 50 metres from his house). The hotel restaurant is clean and good value. The hotel staff are helpful. Its hard to fault the hotel and this is Venice and the buildings are very old but you get what you pay for.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Malibran
HotelInfo.Address: Corte Millon Cannaregio, 5864, 30131 Venice, Italy
